title: Gateway Network Exposure
description: Gateway bound to public interface — accessible from the internet
steps: Read ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json → gateway.bind
If 0.0.0.0, lan, or non-loopback: VERIFIED FAIL
If loopback/127.0.0.1: probe external interface. Blocked → VERIFIED PASS
fix: openclaw config set gateway.bind loopback

title: Gateway Authentication
description: No authentication on gateway — anyone who can reach it controls your agent
steps: Read ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json → gateway.auth
Auth disabled/no token: FAIL
Auth enabled: attempt unauthenticated WebSocket (5s). Connects → VERIFIED FAIL. Rejected → VERIFIED PASS
fix: openclaw config set gateway.auth.mode token && openclaw config set gateway.auth.token "$(openssl rand -hex 32)"

title: Cloud Metadata Service
description: Cloud metadata endpoint accessible — agent can steal IAM credentials
steps: curl -s -m 2 http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/
HTTP 200: VERIFIED FAIL. Timeout: PASS. Not on cloud: SKIP
fix: sudo iptables -A OUTPUT -d 169.254.169.254 -j DROP

title: Personal Email as Agent Identity
description: Personal email used as agent identity — compromise means impersonation
steps: Read ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json → email config
Match against gmail.com, yahoo.com, hotmail.com, outlook.com, icloud.com, protonmail.com, etc.
Match: FAIL. Custom domain or no email: PASS
fix: Use a dedicated agent email on a domain you control

title: Plaintext API Keys in Config
description: API keys in plaintext config files — any skill or process can read them
steps: Scan: ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json, ~/.openclaw/.env, .env, openclaw.json
Patterns: sk- (20+), sk-ant-, AKIA (16), ghp_ (36), xoxb-/xoxp-, AIza (35)
Any match: FAIL (report file + type, never echo the key)
fix: chmod 600 ~/.openclaw/.env && openclaw config set auth.keychain true

title: Sensitive Files Accessible
description: SSH keys, cloud credentials, or other sensitive files readable by agent
steps: Test readable: ~/.ssh/id_rsa, ~/.ssh/id_ed25519, ~/.aws/credentials, ~/.config/gcloud/application_default_credentials.json, ~/.kube/config, ~/.npmrc, ~/.docker/config.json, ~/.netrc
3+: VERIFIED FAIL. 1-2: WARN. None: VERIFIED PASS
fix: openclaw config set sandbox.mode all

title: Secrets in Session Transcripts
description: API keys, credit cards, or SSNs found in conversation history files
steps: OPT-IN: Ask user consent. Declined → SKIP
Scan 10 most recent files in ~/.openclaw/agents/*/sessions/*.jsonl
Credit cards, SSNs, API keys found → VERIFIED FAIL (report count, never values)
fix: openclaw config set logging.redactSensitive tools

title: Docker Privileged Mode
description: Container running with --privileged, host network, or full filesystem mount
steps: Check if running in Docker: test -f /.dockerenv
docker inspect: check Privileged, NetworkMode=host, Binds mounting / or /home
Privileged or host net or full mount: VERIFIED FAIL. Not in Docker: SKIP
fix: Remove --privileged, use bridge networking, mount only needed dirs

title: Agent Running as Root
description: Agent process running as UID 0 — any compromise is full system compromise
steps: Check: id -u (or stat /proc/self if in container)
UID 0: VERIFIED FAIL. Non-root: PASS
fix: Run agent as unprivileged user: useradd -r openclaw && su openclaw

title: Sandbox Configuration
description: No sandbox — agent code runs directly on host with full access
steps: Read ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json → sandbox.mode
off/not set: FAIL. non-main: WARN. all + session scope: PASS. all + shared scope: WARN
fix: openclaw config set sandbox.mode all && openclaw config set sandbox.scope session

title: Elevated Mode Restrictions
description: Elevated mode unrestricted — any session can escape the sandbox
steps: Read ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json → tools.elevated
allowFrom * or all: FAIL. Restricted: PASS. Not configured: PASS
fix: openclaw config set tools.elevated.allowFrom ["your-telegram-id"]

title: Config File Permissions
description: Config files readable by group or others — secrets exposed to other users
steps: Check: ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json, ~/.openclaw/.env, ~/.openclaw/credentials/*, auth-profiles.json
Any > 600 (files) or > 700 (dirs): FAIL. All owner-only: PASS
fix: chmod 600 ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json ~/.openclaw/.env

title: Installed Skills Threat Intel
description: Known-malicious or unverified skills installed — supply chain risk
steps: List ~/.openclaw/skills/

Check against: data-exfil, keylogger, reverse-shell, crypto-miner, credential-stealer, prompt-injector, shadow-agent, backdoor-tool, solana-wallet-tracker, polymarket-trader, token-sniper, atomic-stealer, openclaw-boost, free-credits, claw-premium, admin-tools
Also flag: no SKILL.md, modified last 24h, npm post-install scripts
Malicious: VERIFIED FAIL. 3+ unverified: WARN. Clean: PASS
fix: rm -rf ~/.openclaw/skills/<malicious-skill>

title: MCP Server Vulnerabilities
description: MCP packages with known CVEs — remote code execution risk
steps: Find MCP packages in agent config, node_modules, MCP config
mcp-remote < 1.1.0, @anthropic/mcp-inspector < 0.7.0, @anthropic/mcp-server-filesystem < 2.1.0, @anthropic/mcp-server-git < 2.1.0
Vulnerable: FAIL. No MCP: SKIP. All patched: PASS
fix: npm update mcp-remote @anthropic/mcp-inspector @anthropic/mcp-server-filesystem

title: OpenClaw Version Security
description: Running a version with known security vulnerabilities
steps: openclaw --version or package.json
< 2.6.1: CVE-2026-25253 (RCE). < 2.5.0: path traversal
Vulnerable: FAIL. Current: PASS
fix: openclaw update

title: Session File Permissions
description: Session files readable by others — conversation history exposed
steps: Check ~/.openclaw/agents/*/sessions/ permissions
Readable by group/others: FAIL. Owner-only: PASS
fix: chmod -R 700 ~/.openclaw/agents/*/sessions/

title: Default Credentials in Config
description: Default or placeholder values in config — unchanged from template
steps: Scan openclaw.json and .env for: change_me, default, placeholder, example, YOUR_, xxx, CHANGEME, TODO
Any match in a value field: FAIL. None found: PASS
fix: Replace all placeholder values with real credentials

title: .env Not in .gitignore
description: Secret files not excluded from git — may be committed accidentally
steps: Check if .env is listed in .gitignore (in cwd and in ~/.openclaw/)
Not present in .gitignore: FAIL. Present: PASS. Not a git repo: SKIP
fix: echo '.env' >> .gitignore && echo '.env.local' >> .gitignore

title: Secrets in Git History
description: API keys or passwords found in git commit history — persist forever
steps: Run: git log --all -p (last 50 commits) and search for API key patterns
Same patterns as CLAW-05: sk-, AKIA, ghp_, xoxb-, etc.
Found: FAIL (report commit hash, never the key). No git: SKIP. Clean: PASS
fix: git filter-branch or BFG Repo-Cleaner to remove secrets, then rotate keys

title: Browser Profiles Accessible
description: Chrome/Firefox/Brave profiles readable — saved passwords and cookies exposed
steps: Test readable: ~/.config/google-chrome/, ~/.config/BraveSoftware/, ~/.mozilla/firefox/, ~/Library/Application Support/Google/Chrome/
Any readable: FAIL. None: PASS
fix: openclaw config set sandbox.mode all

title: Git Credentials Accessible
description: Git credential files readable — repository tokens and passwords exposed
steps: Test readable: ~/.git-credentials, ~/.gitconfig (check for credential helpers storing tokens)
Plaintext credentials found: FAIL. No credential files: PASS
fix: Use SSH keys instead, or credential-cache with short timeout

title: Database Credentials Accessible
description: Database credential files readable — direct database access possible
steps: Test readable: ~/.pgpass, ~/.my.cnf, ~/.mongosh/, ~/.redis-cli-history
Any found and readable: FAIL. None: PASS
fix: chmod 600 ~/.pgpass ~/.my.cnf && openclaw config set sandbox.mode all

title: Additional Services on 0.0.0.0
description: Other agent services bound to all interfaces — publicly reachable
steps: Run: ss -tlnp or netstat -tlnp
Check for services on 0.0.0.0 or ::: at common agent ports (3000, 5000, 8000, 8080, 8888)
Any found: FAIL (list ports). None: PASS
fix: Bind services to 127.0.0.1 in their respective configs

title: No Firewall Rules
description: No firewall configured — every listening port is exposed
steps: Check: iptables -L -n, ufw status, nftables list
No rules or firewall inactive: FAIL. Active with rules: PASS. macOS with pf disabled: WARN
fix: ufw enable && ufw default deny incoming && ufw allow ssh

title: Container Security Profile
description: No seccomp/AppArmor profile — container escape risk via runC CVEs
steps: If in Docker: docker inspect → SecurityOpt
No seccomp or AppArmor profile (unconfined): FAIL. Profile applied: PASS. Not in container: SKIP
fix: Run with --security-opt seccomp=default --security-opt apparmor=docker-default

title: Agent Code Integrity
description: Uncommitted modifications to agent source — potential backdoor
steps: cd to agent install dir, run git status/diff
Uncommitted changes to source files: FAIL. Clean: PASS. Not a git repo: SKIP
fix: git diff to review changes, git checkout -- . to revert if unauthorized

title: npm Lifecycle Scripts in Skills
description: Skills with lifecycle scripts — arbitrary code runs on install
steps: For each skill in ~/.openclaw/skills/, check package.json for preinstall/postinstall/prepare scripts
Scripts found: WARN (list them). Known malicious patterns (curl|wget|eval|exec): VERIFIED FAIL. None: PASS
fix: Remove suspect skills and reinstall from verified sources

title: Log Redaction
description: Log redaction disabled — secrets may appear in log files
steps: Read ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json → logging.redactSensitive
Not set or off: FAIL. tools (default): PASS
fix: openclaw config set logging.redactSensitive tools

title: Debug Logging Enabled
description: Debug/verbose logging active — extra data including payloads leaked to logs
steps: Read ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json → logging.level
debug or verbose: FAIL. info/warn/error: PASS. Not set (defaults to info): PASS
fix: openclaw config set logging.level info

title: Sessions Synced to Cloud
description: Session files inside cloud-synced folder — history uploaded to iCloud/Dropbox
steps: Check if ~/.openclaw/ path contains: Mobile Documents, iCloud, Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive
Inside sync folder: FAIL. Outside: PASS
fix: Move ~/.openclaw/ outside synced folders, or add to .nosync

title: MCP Tool Description Poisoning
description: Invisible Unicode in MCP tool descriptions can hijack agent behavior
steps: Scan MCP config files for invisible Unicode (zero-width spaces, bidirectional overrides, tag characters)
Also scan for suspicious keywords: ignore previous, exfiltrate, override
Invisible Unicode found: VERIFIED FAIL. Suspicious keywords: WARN. Clean: PASS

title: MCP Tool Shadowing
description: Duplicate tool names across MCP servers — malicious server intercepts calls
steps: Parse all MCP server configs, extract tool names
Build map of tool_name → [servers]. Any name in 2+ servers: VERIFIED FAIL
All unique: PASS. No MCP: SKIP
fix: openclaw mcp list-tools --check-duplicates && openclaw config set mcp.allowedServers ["filesystem","git"]

title: Unrestricted Outbound Network
description: No egress filtering — compromised agent can exfiltrate data to any server
steps: Check network.allowedHosts in config. Not set or *: test outbound (curl httpbin.org)
Unrestricted outbound confirmed: VERIFIED FAIL. Allowlist configured: PASS
fix: openclaw config set network.allowedHosts ["api.anthropic.com","api.openai.com"]

title: Messaging Platform Token Exposure
description: Telegram/Slack/Discord tokens in plaintext config — full bot impersonation
steps: Scan config and .env for: Telegram bot tokens (digits:base64), Slack (xoxb-/xoxp-), Discord tokens
Tokens found + lax file perms: FAIL. Tokens via env vars: PASS. None: PASS
fix: Move tokens to env vars, chmod 600 .env, rotate exposed tokens

title: No User Namespace Isolation
description: Container root maps to host root — container escape is full host compromise
steps: Check /proc/self/uid_map
0 0 4294967295 → no remapping: FAIL. Non-zero mapping: PASS. Not in Docker: SKIP
fix: Add "userns-remap": "default" to /etc/docker/daemon.json, restart Docker

title: Dangerous CLI Flags in Startup
description: Agent started with --yolo or --dangerously-skip-permissions — zero protection
steps: Check /proc/self/cmdline and startup scripts for: --dangerously-skip-permissions, --yolo, --trust-all-tools, --disable-sandbox
Check env vars: OPENCLAW_SKIP_PERMISSIONS, OPENCLAW_YOLO
Any found: VERIFIED FAIL. None: PASS
fix: Remove all dangerous flags. Use explicit, minimal permission grants instead.

title: Writable Agent Installation Directory
description: Agent can modify its own code — prompt injection can install persistent backdoor
steps: Find OpenClaw install dir (dirname $(which openclaw))
test -w: writable → FAIL. Read-only: PASS. Not found: SKIP
fix: chown -R root:root /path/to/openclaw && chmod -R a-w /path/to/openclaw

title: No Rate Limiting on Agent API
description: No rate limiting on gateway — Denial of Wallet attacks can run up LLM costs
steps: Read gateway.rateLimit.enabled from config
Not set or false: FAIL. Enabled: PASS
fix: openclaw config set gateway.rateLimit.enabled true && openclaw config set gateway.rateLimit.maxPerMinute 60

title: Cryptocurrency Wallet Files Accessible
description: Crypto wallet files readable by agent — funds can be drained irreversibly
steps: Test readable: Exodus, Electrum, Bitcoin, Ethereum dirs (macOS + Linux)
Also search for seed/mnemonic/recovery files in home dir
2+: VERIFIED FAIL. 1: WARN. None: PASS
fix: chmod 700 ~/.bitcoin ~/.ethereum ~/.electrum; run agent as dedicated user

title: Unsafe Deserialization in Dependencies
description: Vulnerable langchain-core or unsafe yaml.load in skills — RCE via prompt injection
steps: Check langchain-core version: < 0.3.81 or 1.0-1.2.4 → FAIL
Scan skills for yaml.load (not safe_load) → FAIL
All clean: PASS
fix: pip install 'langchain-core>=0.3.81' && replace yaml.load with yaml.safe_load

title: No Container Read-Only Filesystem
description: Writable container filesystem — compromised agent can install persistent malware
steps: Check /proc/mounts for root filesystem
ro flag: PASS. rw: FAIL. Not in Docker: SKIP
fix: docker run --read-only --tmpfs /tmp:rw,noexec,nosuid ...

title: Skill Network Access Unrestricted
description: No per-skill network permissions — any skill can exfiltrate data externally
steps: Read plugins.permissions and plugins.defaultDeny from config
No per-skill permissions: FAIL. defaultDeny includes network: PASS
fix: openclaw config set plugins.defaultDeny network

title: Unencrypted Session Storage
description: Session files stored unencrypted — disk compromise exposes full conversation history
steps: Read sessions.encryptAtRest from config
Not set or false: FAIL (if sessions exist). Enabled: PASS
fix: openclaw config set sessions.encryptAtRest true

title: Rules File Injection
description: CLAUDE.md or rules files contain invisible Unicode or suspicious injection patterns
steps: Scan CLAUDE.md, .openclaw/rules.md, agent system prompts
Check for invisible Unicode, injection keywords, suspiciously long lines
Invisible Unicode: VERIFIED FAIL. Suspicious keywords: WARN. Clean: PASS
fix: perl -CSD -pe 's/[\\x{200B}-\\x{200F}\\x{202A}-\\x{202E}]//g' -i CLAUDE.md

title: Stale or Unrotated API Keys
description: Credential files not modified in 90+ days — extended window for stolen key abuse
steps: Check last modification time of .env and openclaw.json
> 90 days: FAIL. 30-90: WARN. < 30: PASS
fix: Rotate API keys now, set auth.rotationReminder 30

title: npm Audit Vulnerabilities
description: Known vulnerabilities in agent npm dependencies — supply chain risk
steps: Run npm audit in agent directory and skill directories
Critical/high vulns: FAIL. Moderate/low: WARN. Clean: PASS
fix: npm audit fix && npm audit fix --force

title: Excessive Tool Permissions
description: Wildcard tool permissions — agent can write anywhere, execute anything
steps: Check tools.filesystem.write, tools.execute.allowed, tools.network.outbound
3+ wildcard categories: FAIL. 1-2: WARN. All scoped: PASS
fix: openclaw config set tools.defaultPolicy deny

title: Insecure MCP Transport
description: Remote MCP servers connected via HTTP — tool data transmitted in cleartext
steps: Parse MCP configs for http:// URLs (excluding localhost/127.0.0.1)
Remote HTTP found: FAIL. All HTTPS or local: PASS
fix: Replace http:// with https:// in MCP config, or use stdio transport

title: No Process Resource Limits
description: No ulimits or cgroup limits — runaway agent can exhaust all host resources
steps: Check ulimit -u (processes), ulimit -n (files), cgroup memory limit
Multiple unlimited: FAIL. Partial: WARN. All limited: PASS
fix: docker run --memory=2g --cpus=2 --pids-limit=256 ... OR ulimit -n 4096 -u 256

title: Exposed Health/Debug Endpoints
description: Debug or config endpoints return 200 — internal state leaked to attackers
steps: Probe gateway at common endpoints: /debug, /env, /config, /admin, /metrics
Any debug/env/config returns 200: FAIL. Only /health: PASS. Gateway not running: SKIP
fix: openclaw config set server.debug false && openclaw config set server.disableEndpoints ["debug","env","config"]

title: WebSocket Origin Validation (CSWSH)
description: Gateway accepts WebSocket connections from any origin — cross-site hijacking possible
steps: Send WebSocket upgrade with Origin: https://evil.example.com
HTTP 101 accepted: VERIFIED FAIL. Rejected: PASS. Gateway not running: check gateway.cors.allowedOrigins in config
fix: openclaw config set gateway.cors.allowedOrigins ["https://your-domain.com"]

title: LLM Endpoint Integrity
description: API base URLs in config do not match expected providers — possible man-in-the-middle
steps: Read API base URLs from config and env (ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL, OPENAI_BASE_URL, etc.)
Check against known providers: api.anthropic.com, api.openai.com, etc.
Flag HTTP_PROXY/HTTPS_PROXY overrides and NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0
Custom/unknown base URL or proxy override: FAIL. Known providers only: PASS
fix: Remove custom base URLs, unset HTTP_PROXY/HTTPS_PROXY, unset NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED

title: Credential Routing Through LLM Context
description: Skill instructions route secrets through the LLM prompt — credentials exposed in context window
steps: Scan SKILL.md and README.md in ~/.openclaw/skills/*/
Search for patterns: 'include your API key', 'paste your token', 'pass your credentials in the message'
Pattern found: FAIL. No skills or clean: PASS
fix: Refactor skills to read credentials from env vars or config, never from the context window

title: Persistent Memory Poisoning
description: Injection markers found in memory or context files — persistent prompt injection risk
steps: Scan ~/.openclaw/memory/, CLAUDE.md, .claude/memory/ for injection markers
Check for: 'ignore previous instructions', base64 payloads, zero-width Unicode
Injection markers found: VERIFIED FAIL. Suspicious patterns: WARN. Clean: PASS
fix: Review and clean memory files, remove injected content, rotate compromised sessions

title: Auto-Approval Beyond --yolo
description: Per-category auto-approve or allowedTools wildcards bypass tool confirmation
steps: Check OpenClaw config for autoApprove, allowedTools: '*'
Check Claude Code settings and MCP configs for per-category auto-approve
Wildcard or broad auto-approve found: FAIL. No auto-approve: PASS
fix: Remove autoApprove flags and wildcard allowedTools, use explicit per-tool permissions

title: Semantic Tool Description Poisoning
description: MCP tool descriptions contain exfiltration instructions or data harvesting patterns
steps: Scan MCP tool configs and skill definitions for social engineering patterns
Check for: 'read ~/.ssh', 'include API key', 'before using this tool first', 'exfiltrate', 'send to'
Pattern found: FAIL. Clean: PASS
fix: Remove or rewrite suspicious tool descriptions, audit skill sources

title: Tool Definition Pinning (Rug-Pull)
description: No integrity check on tool definitions — server can change tool behavior after approval
steps: Check MCP configs for tool definition hashes, pinning, or version locks
No integrity mechanism: WARN. Hashes or pinning configured: PASS
fix: Pin MCP tool definitions with hashes or version locks where supported

title: MCP Credential Hygiene
description: MCP servers use long-lived PATs instead of short-lived OAuth tokens
steps: Parse MCP server configs for token patterns: ghp_, glpat-, xoxb-, xoxp-
Check OAuth scopes for overly broad permissions: admin, org, write:all
Check for inline secrets in config
Long-lived tokens or broad scopes: FAIL. Narrow scopes, short-lived: PASS
fix: Replace long-lived tokens with short-lived ones, narrow OAuth scopes to minimum required

title: Dormant Payload Detection
description: Conditional or time-based triggers found in persistent context — delayed attack risk
steps: Scan persistent context files for conditional triggers
Check for: 'if date is after', 'when the user asks about', base64 near conditionals
Trigger patterns found: VERIFIED FAIL. Suspicious patterns: WARN. Clean: PASS
fix: Review and remove conditional payloads from context files, reset memory

title: Observability Endpoint Security
description: Telemetry endpoints use HTTP or have known CVEs — trace data exposed
steps: Check config and env for telemetry endpoints: LANGSMITH_ENDPOINT, LANGFUSE_HOST, HELICONE_BASE_URL
HTTP endpoint found: FAIL. HTTPS or no telemetry: PASS
fix: Update telemetry endpoints to use HTTPS

title: Skill Typosquatting Detection
description: Installed skill name is suspiciously similar to a popular skill — possible typosquatting
steps: List installed skills in ~/.openclaw/skills/
Compare names against known popular skills using edit distance 1-2
Near-match found (edit distance 1-2): WARN. Exact malicious match: FAIL. All clean: PASS
fix: Remove typosquatted skills and install from verified sources

title: Sandbox Runtime Detection
description: Container uses default runc runtime — weaker isolation than gVisor or Firecracker
steps: Detect container runtime: check for /proc/self/status gVisor markers, /sys/hypervisor for Firecracker
runc: WARN (note stronger alternatives). gVisor or Firecracker: PASS. Not in container: SKIP
fix: Switch to gVisor (runsc) or Firecracker for stronger container isolation

title: Writable Persistence Paths
description: Agent can write to crontab, shell configs, or launch agents — persistence vector for injected payloads
steps: Test writable: ~/.bashrc, ~/.zshrc, ~/.profile, ~/Library/LaunchAgents/, ~/.config/systemd/user/
Check cron write access: crontab -l
3+: VERIFIED FAIL. 1-2: WARN. None: PASS
fix: Run agent as dedicated user without write access to shell configs and startup dirs

title: Active C2 Connection Detection
description: Check active network connections against known C2 infrastructure IPs from the ClawHavoc campaign.
steps: Check active network connections against known C2 IP list
Match found: VERIFIED FAIL. No matches: PASS
fix: Kill suspicious connections: ss -tlnp | grep <C2_IP> && kill <PID>

title: Malware Signature Scan
description: Scan installed skills for AMOS stealer patterns, reverse shell markers, and known malicious file hashes.
steps: Scan installed skills for AMOS stealer signatures and known malicious hashes
Malware signature found: VERIFIED FAIL. Clean: PASS
fix: rm -rf ~/.openclaw/skills/<infected-skill> && rotate all credentials

title: Exfiltration Domain References
description: Check skill files for references to known exfiltration services (webhook.site, pipedream.net, ngrok.io, etc.).
steps: Scan skill source files for known exfiltration domains: webhook.site, ngrok.io, requestbin.com, pipedream.com, burpcollaborator.net
Domain reference found: FAIL. Clean: PASS
fix: Remove or replace skills referencing exfiltration domains

title: VS Code Extension Trojans
description: Detect fake OpenClaw VS Code extensions — OpenClaw has no official extension, so any match is malicious.
steps: Check installed VS Code extensions for OpenClaw-related names
Any OpenClaw extension found: VERIFIED FAIL (OpenClaw has no official extension). None: PASS. VS Code not installed: SKIP
fix: code --uninstall-extension <fake-extension-id> && rotate credentials

title: Gateway Device Auth Bypass
description: Check if dangerouslyDisableDeviceAuth is enabled or if LAN-bound gateway lacks trustedProxies config.
steps: Read ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json → gateway.dangerouslyDisableDeviceAuth and gateway.trustedProxies
dangerouslyDisableDeviceAuth=true or trustedProxies contains *: VERIFIED FAIL. Both secure: PASS
fix: openclaw config set gateway.dangerouslyDisableDeviceAuth false && openclaw config set gateway.trustedProxies '[]'

title: Exec-Approvals Hardening
description: Verify exec-approvals.json doesn't have allow-all security settings or disabled confirmation prompts.
steps: Read exec-approvals.json or equivalent approval config
Wildcard approvals or approve-all patterns: FAIL. Scoped approvals: PASS. No file: SKIP
fix: Restrict exec-approvals.json to specific commands and paths

title: mDNS/Bonjour Exposure
description: Check if mDNS broadcasting is in 'full' mode, which exposes file paths and SSH ports to the local network.
steps: Check for mDNS/Bonjour service advertisements related to OpenClaw
Broadcasting agent paths/ports: FAIL. No mDNS advertisements: PASS. mDNS not available: SKIP
fix: Disable mDNS advertisement for agent services or restrict to loopback

title: DM Channel Restrictions
description: Check messaging channel DM policies for open access — channels with dmPolicy='open' or wildcard allowFrom let anyone message the agent.
steps: Read channel config for DM policies
Unrestricted DM access or no DM policy: FAIL. DM restricted to approved contacts: PASS
fix: openclaw config set channels.dm.policy restricted

title: Known Malicious Publishers
description: Check installed skill package.json files against a blacklist of known malicious ClawHub publishers.
steps: List installed skills and extract publisher/author metadata
Check against known malicious publisher blacklist
Blacklisted publisher found: VERIFIED FAIL. All clean: PASS
fix: rm -rf ~/.openclaw/skills/<blacklisted-skill> && openclaw skills install <verified-alternative>
